DOC.detailed_description: This study use prospective non-randomized , non-controlled design . Five-hundred ( 500 ) subject previously receive peripheral intravenous therapy enrol single treatment group . The purpose study evaluate safety , feasibility , cursory utility low-light source integrate exist peripheral intravenous catheter . The absence control group base follow reason : This pilot investigation establish baseline understanding safety , feasibility , cursory utility polychromatic light emit diode integrated exist 20-gauge 1.0 inch peripheral intravascular catheter improve self-reported overall subject energy level base change Epworth Sleepiness score . DOC.criteria: Voluntarily sign informed consent form Ages 1870 Completed urine pregnancy examination negative result Selfreported energy level > 4 Epworth sleepiness test No breastfeed 3 month prior enrollment Active infection along potential intravenous catheter site Pacemaker Currently take prescription blood thin medication ( i.e . Warfarin ) Suffering chronic , progressive blood disorder , blood cancer ( Thalassemia , Lymphoma , Myeloma , etc . ) Use antiinflammatory medication chronic basis ( i.e . ibuprofen , aspirin , steroid ) Suffering blood clot disorder ( hypercoagulable condition , thrombocytosis , etc . ) Clinically significant anxiety and/or depression Participated clinical study last 30 day Clinical Cardiac Disease Active Infection
